shortlist.name: Fasol
shortlist.odds_note: 7/4 SBK, 3.0 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form at a higher level, regularly placing or winning. Trained by Paul Nicholls and ridden by Harry Cobdenâ€”one of the top combinations in UK jumps racing. No sign of regression in form and holds the best credentials on both class and reliability.

shortlist.name: Frontier Prince
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 4.2 exchange (second choice in market, solid support)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a recent runner-up finish after a break, suggesting fitness and readiness. Fergal O'Brien is a trainer in excellent form, and Jonathan Burke is a reliable jockey. Consistent at this level and should be competitive again.

shortlist.name: Masked Man (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Market leader with a top jockey and trainer combination. No recent form to assess, but connections are strong and odds reflect confidence. Likely to be fit and ready, but slight risk due to lack of recent runs.

shortlist.name: Tashan
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form (2-1-1) suggests he is in peak condition and ready to win. Jockey and trainer are both in form. Odds offer solid value for a horse with proven recent ability.

shortlist.name: Doctors Hill
shortlist.rationale: Ran well last time out (2nd) and is trained by a leading yard. Slightly bigger odds than the front two, but form suggests he is capable of winning if improving for the run. Represents decent each-way value.
shortlist.confidence: Medium (form suggests potential, but needs to step up)

shortlist.name: Lahinch Wave (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with a win and third place in last two starts. Market leader at short odds reflects solid confidence. Recent form progression suggests horse is approaching peak fitness. Competitive odds provide fair value given consistency.

shortlist.name: Kosasiempre (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form pattern showing multiple placed efforts including recent second and third. French-bred experience adds versatility. Competitive odds at 4/1 offer value for a horse regularly finishing in the frame. Stuart Edmunds yard in form.

shortlist.name: Springs A Girl (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent runner-up finish shows return to form. Sean Bowen is a top-class conditional jockey. Form figures include multiple wins and placed efforts. Current odds provide each-way value with improving fitness trajectory.

shortlist.name: Somespring Special (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Hobbs & Johnson White are elite trainers with strong strike rates. Recent form shows consistency with second place and third. Recent win (0 in form string) demonstrates current ability. Fall marked 'F' followed by recovery indicates resilience.

shortlist.name: Lord Accord (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 4.2 exchange (clear favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level with strong recent form figures, including a close second last time out. Proven stamina and fitness, with connections in good form. Market support confirms expectations.

shortlist.name: Courtland (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 4.6 exchange (well-fancied, second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Placed on all three starts this season, showing consistency and reliability. Suited by conditions and retains a competitive mark. Jockey/trainer combination is respected.

shortlist.name: Le Milos
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 SBK, 7 exchange (solid each-way support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to winning ways last time out after a break, indicating readiness and ability. Top connections and proven class at this level. Slightly bigger price offers value if building on latest effort.

shortlist.name: Queensbury Boy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form showing win and multiple placings. Market leader with tight odds indicating confidence from both bookmakers and exchange punters. Fifth last time out may have been over unsuitable conditions but pattern shows consistency at this level.

shortlist.name: Jack Hyde (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Excellent recent win last time out, part of strong sequence including two seconds and fourth. Form cycle suggests horse is in peak condition. Fergal O'Brien yard in good form and Jonathan Burke partnership proven. Offers value at current odds given winning momentum.

shortlist.name: Sticktotheplan (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Strong winning sequence with three consecutive wins (2-1-2-1 reading right to left) before recent setback. Sean Bowen is a leading conditional jockey and Olly Murphy stable has strong strike rate. Despite eighth place interrupting sequence, horse has proven winning ability at this grade.

shortlist.name: Welcom To Cartries (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Strong form and connections with Paul Nicholls and Harry Cobden. Recent performances suggest consistency and potential for improvement.

shortlist.name: Double Powerful (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows a strong pattern of performance, indicating a high level of fitness and readiness to compete.

shortlist.name: Coco Mademoiselle (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent wins suggest a peak in form, but the odds offer value considering the trainer and jockey combination.

shortlist.name: Lundi Noir (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 5.9 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Won sole UK start last season, suggesting strong ability and potential for further improvement. Returns for a respected yard with a reliable jockey. Market support is notable and connections are in form. No evidence of needing major improvement; fitness assumed based on stable's typical readiness.

shortlist.name: Razzle Dazzle Boy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer last season, placed multiple times and ended campaign with a good second. Proven stamina and race fitness, with a top jockey booked. Connections are capable at this level. No major improvement required to be competitive.

shortlist.name: Got A Dream (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 6/1 SBK, 7.4 exchange (respected in the market, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced and showed ability in novice company; recent form figures suggest potential for progress. Yard can ready one after a break and the jockey is reliable. Market position indicates some confidence. Does not require a major leap to contend.

shortlist.name: Sweet Caryline
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 5.7 exchange (solid market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Returned from a break with a win last time, showing clear improvement and fitness. Consistent profile last season, and connections are in good form. Odds indicate strong market confidence and she does not require major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Roaring Home
shortlist.rationale: Solid reappearance run (2nd) after a mixed but competitive campaign last season. Proven at this level and with a top jockey/trainer combination. Market position reflects realistic winning chance without needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: La Belle Argentee (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 6.8 exchange (favourite or near-favourite, strong market position)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced and open to further progress after a promising second on seasonal return. Top connections (Skelton team) and market support suggest strong expectations. No evidence she needs major improvement to win here.

shortlist.name: Tarot
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form (223) suggests a horse on the improve, with each run showing progression. Trained by Roger Varian and ridden by Rossa Ryan, both top connections. Short price reflects market confidence, but the form cycle indicates further upside is possible[1].

shortlist.name: Albaydaa (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Single run to date (3rd) for a top yard (Haggas) and jockey (Donohoe). Likely to improve for debut experience, and the market respects potential. Odds offer value if expected to step forward[1].

shortlist.name: Valdorcia (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Also unexposed after one run (3rd) for a leading stable (Appleby). Expected to progress, but slightly bigger odds than Albaydaa reflects slightly less market confidence. Still a credible contender if improving as expected[1].

shortlist.name: Fanjove (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Comes in off a win and consistent recent form, indicating peak condition. Connections are strong, and the odds reflect market confidence. No signs of decline; profile fits a progressive, reliable winner at this level.

shortlist.name: Royalist (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows improvement with a solid third last time. Trainer is respected at Kempton, and odds suggest genuine market support. Needs only minor progress to contend, making him the main danger to the favourite.

shortlist.name: Little She (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistently competitive in recent runs, showing ability to place and perform at this level. Connections are solid, and current odds reflect strong market support. No major improvement needed; form is reliable for this grade.

shortlist.name: My Boy Harry
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is consistent, regularly finishing in the frame and showing ability to compete. Connections are capable, and odds offer reasonable value for a horse with proven reliability at this level.

shortlist.name: Wesam (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won on debut, indicating immediate ability and readiness. Top connections with Saeed bin Suroor and Hector Crouch add confidence. Current odds reflect strong market support and suggest little improvement needed for repeat success.

shortlist.name: Oursin
shortlist.rationale: Solid runner-up on debut, showing promise and likely improvement. Charles Hills is a respected trainer, and Rob Hornby is a reliable jockey. Odds indicate market respect and realistic winning chance without needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Bay Of Light
shortlist.rationale: Unraced but represents top connections in Charlie Appleby and Rossa Ryan. Market support suggests stable confidence and potential for a strong debut. Only included due to connections and odds, not requiring major improvement.

shortlist.name: Sunshine Star
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections with John & Thady Gosden, who excel with unexposed types at Kempton. The market strongly supports this runner, indicating confidence from both bookmakers and exchange. Lack of public form is typical for a well-bred debutant from this yard, and such horses often win first time out at this level.

shortlist.name: Brighlee (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form figures (placed twice, second last time) suggest reliability and readiness. Trainer David Menuisier is adept with progressive French-bred fillies, and Rossa Ryan is a strong booking. The odds reflect genuine market respect, and the horse does not require major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: She Commands (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Trainer Ralph Beckett is noted for improving fillies on the all-weather. She Commands showed promise on debut and is expected to progress, with the market keeping her safe. Connections are respected and the odds indicate she is not considered an outsider.

shortlist.name: Waiting All Night
shortlist.rationale: Consistently competitive in recent runs, regularly finishing mid-pack or better. Current odds indicate strong market confidence. Connections are capable at this level and the horse has shown ability to handle all-weather surfaces.

shortlist.name: Absolute Star
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts back and generally consistent form. Trainer Roger Varian is highly respected and jockey booking is positive. Odds reflect genuine winning chance and connections are in good form.

shortlist.name: Daisy Roots
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 7.4 exchange (solid third choice, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win last time out and another win four starts back. Consistent performer at this level and proven on the surface. Odds are competitive and indicate market respect.

shortlist.name: Pride Of Donegal (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form in the frame, progressive profile, and represents a trainer in strong form. Short odds reflect both form and market confidence. No signs of regression and should be suited by conditions.

shortlist.name: Caspian King (Ger)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 (SBK), 4.9 (Exchange) â€“ solid second choice in market
shortlist.rationale: Recent runs in competitive company, holding form well and now finds a slightly easier opportunity. Trainer and jockey both capable at this level. Odds offer some value for a horse with proven ability at the trip.

shortlist.name: Kingmaker (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with recent improvement, strong trainer-jockey combination.

shortlist.name: My Kinda Ghaiy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Steady form, though not improving significantly. Odds reflect potential value.

shortlist.name: John T
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows potential for a strong run, decent odds value.

shortlist.name: Me Tarzan (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with three wins in last eight starts including two seconds. Strong recent form (1st, 8th, 4th, 2nd, 2nd) shows reliability at this level. Fanshawe is an experienced trainer with proven record. Realistic odds reflect genuine winning chance without being overbet.

shortlist.name: Savvy Exchange (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Joint-favorite with Ryan, a top-class jockey. Recent form shows fifth and sixth placings indicating competitiveness at this grade. Odds suggest market confidence. Ryan's booking is significant positive indicator for a horse that has shown it can compete at this level.

shortlist.name: Waistcoat
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with win, fourth, third, fifth, first in last five starts. Two wins in last eight outings demonstrates current ability. Form cycle shows horse is competitive and capable of winning at this class. Value odds given the winning record.

shortlist.name: Brussels
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at a high level with strong connections (O'Brien/Soumillon). Recent form is solid, always in the mix, and odds reflect strong market confidence. No sign of regression and proven at this class.

shortlist.name: Revival Power (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two recent wins and a solid second. Form suggests ongoing improvement, and odds indicate strong support. Connections are reliable and the horse is peaking at the right time.

shortlist.name: Calendar Girl
shortlist.odds_note: Strong market support; 11/5 SBK, 3.45 exchange (clear favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive filly with two wins from last three starts, including a recent victory. Form suggests she is still improving and connections are in good order. Current odds reflect strong confidence from both bookmakers and exchange, indicating she is expected to be highly competitive.

shortlist.name: Classic Cuvee
shortlist.odds_note: Solid value; 5/1 SBK, 6.4 exchange (well-backed, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with a win and a second in two starts, showing clear ability and scope for further improvement. Top connections with Buick and Varian add confidence. Odds are competitive for a runner with proven form and upside.

shortlist.name: Mubasimah (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 6.4 exchange (market respect for debut winner)
shortlist.rationale: Impressive debut winner, suggesting significant potential. Top jockey/trainer combination and market support indicate expectations for further progress. While less exposed, debut win and connections justify inclusion.

shortlist.name: Cosmic Year
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win and consistent placings, suggesting strong current form. Odds reflect its status as a favorite.

shortlist.name: Poet Master (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Has shown winning form and recent improvement with a second place. Trainer and jockey combination is experienced.

shortlist.name: Audience
shortlist.rationale: Trained by a respected team and has shown some consistency. Recent form suggests potential for improvement.

shortlist.name: Precise (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Outstanding recent form (2111) suggests peak fitness and consistency at the top level. Top-class connections (O'Brien/Soumillon) and a strong win sequence make this the most reliable contender. Odds are justified by proven class and upward trajectory.

shortlist.name: Composing (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form (511143) in strong company, with only one unplaced run in last six. O'Brien stable is in excellent form and this runner is proven at the required level. Slightly bigger odds offer value for a horse with solid claims.

shortlist.name: Legacy Link
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced but progressive, with a win and a close third in two starts. Gosden yard is respected and the horse is open to further improvement. Odds are fair for a potential improver, though less exposed than main rivals.

shortlist.name: Dance To The Music
shortlist.rationale: Won two of last three, including a strong performance last time out. Appleby/Buick is a potent combination and the horse is clearly in form. Odds are generous for a horse with recent winning momentum.

shortlist.name: Respond (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form, including a win and a close third last time out. Top jockey and trainer combination. Odds reflect strong chance but still offer value for a horse with proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Munsif (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won two of last three starts, including a strong victory last time. Trainer in form and jockey booking solid. Odds represent value for a horse with upward trajectory and proven winning form.

shortlist.name: Dangerman
shortlist.rationale: Won two of last four, placed in another. Top-class jockey and trainer. Form suggests he is competitive at this level and may still be improving. Odds are fair for a horse with recent winning form and strong connections.

shortlist.name: Act Of Kindness
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form and top connections with William Buick and Charlie Appleby. The odds reflect its strong chances.

shortlist.name: Wadooda
shortlist.rationale: Competitive odds suggest potential, though form is not detailed. Trainer Owen Burrows is known for quality runners.

shortlist.name: La Mer Noire (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Oisin Murphy is a skilled jockey, and Andrew Balding's training could bring out the best in this horse despite lacking detailed form.

shortlist.name: Falakeyah
shortlist.rationale: Progressive filly with two wins from three starts, including a strong seasonal reappearance. Connections are in good form and odds reflect strong market support. No signs of regression in recent form.

shortlist.name: Sand Gazelle
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with recent win and runner-up effort at this level. Top connections and jockey booking add confidence. Form suggests reliability and ability to handle competitive fields.

shortlist.name: Spirited Style
shortlist.rationale: Early season form was excellent with two wins, and recent runs can be excused given step up in class. Trainer excels with this profile and odds offer fair value for a bounce-back.

shortlist.name: Whip Cracker (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows consistency with a couple of strong finishes, indicating potential for a win.

shortlist.name: Bopedro (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Competitive odds and a strong trainer-jockey combination make this horse a contender.

shortlist.name: Northern Express (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is mixed but the odds suggest value, especially with a capable jockey.

shortlist.name: Ghost Mode (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows consistent improvement, culminating in a win. Strong connections with Andrew Balding and P. J. McDonald.

shortlist.name: Real American (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second favorite at 6.4 on the exchange
shortlist.rationale: Recent win indicates strong current form. Trainer K. R. Burke has a good reputation.

shortlist.name: Astrazar (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Competitive odds at 9 on the exchange
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with a recent win. Ed Walker is a capable trainer.

shortlist.name: Hornsea Bay
shortlist.rationale: Consistent in top company, proven at the track, and in the hands of a top jockey-trainer combination. Recent form shows solid efforts in competitive races, suggesting he is at his peak and ready to strike. The odds are fair for a horse of his proven class and connections.

shortlist.name: Mukhtalif (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win last time out and placed efforts in all recent starts. Trained by a leading yard and ridden by a top apprentice. The form suggests he is still improving and the odds represent value for a horse on an upward curve.

shortlist.name: Jupiter Ammon (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer, often finishing in the frame. Trainer and jockey are both in form. The horse is proven at the trip and track, and the odds offer some each-way value given his reliability.

shortlist.name: Thaluna
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form and competitive odds make Thaluna a top contender. The trainer, William Haggas, is well-respected, and the jockey, Cieren Fallon, is experienced.

shortlist.name: La Belle Forest (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Although lacking recent form data, La Belle Forest is the second favorite, indicating market confidence. Trainer K. R. Burke has a good reputation, which supports its potential.

shortlist.name: Clear Force (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two placings in last three starts (2nd, 4th). Karl Burke yard in good form. Odds suggest market confidence and proven at this level with multiple top-three finishes.

shortlist.name: Sands Of Spain (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Two wins in form string (1st, 1st) show winning ability. Andrew Balding/P.J. McDonald combination reliable. Recent 4th acceptable, previous double victories indicate horse can win at this grade.

shortlist.name: Utmost Respect (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Richard Fahey stable in excellent form. Recent 4th keeps horse competitive, proven winning form earlier (0 indicates win). Oisin Orr capable jockey, odds represent value for proven Fahey runner.

shortlist.name: Mighty Magnus (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Highly consistent form with three seconds in last four runs (2nd, 4th, 2nd). Knocking on door for breakthrough win. Michael Dods yard competitive, odds offer value for consistent performer.

shortlist.name: Kinswoman
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 7.6 exchange (solid market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive filly with two wins from last two starts, showing clear improvement and consistency. Trained by William Haggas, a top yard, and partnered by a strong jockey. Recent form figures suggest she is peaking at the right time and is well placed at this level.

shortlist.name: Eternal Sunshine
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with three wins and two places in last six starts. Recent form is strong, and the horse has shown the ability to hold form over several runs. Connections are reliable and the odds indicate market respect.

shortlist.name: Roach Power (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Has won two of last three starts and placed consistently prior. Recent wins suggest the horse is in peak form. Trainer and jockey combination is capable, and the odds reflect realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Quest For Fun
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 7.6 exchange (solid market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes, indicating reliability and current competitiveness at this level. Connections are in form and the odds reflect strong market confidence. No need for major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Vixey
shortlist.odds_note: 17/2 SBK, 11.5 exchange (short enough to indicate respect, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Exceptionally consistent with multiple wins and placings in recent starts, showing peak form. Proven ability to win repeatedly at this grade and distance. Odds offer value for a horse with such a strong profile.

shortlist.name: Luker's Tipple (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with multiple placed efforts, including two recent seconds; top connections in Cromwell/Donoghue; market leader for good reasonâ€”no need for improvement, just needs to reproduce recent runs.

shortlist.name: Black Gem (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced but showed promise in both starts; McConnell stable in form; odds offer some value if able to step forward from debut, but needs to confirm ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Derry Lad (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 6/5 (exchange 2.24), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Represents a top stable with a strong record in these events. Despite a recent fall and an eighth, the horse is lightly raced and open to improvement. The market support is significant, and connections are notable for targeting winnable races with progressive types.

shortlist.name: Oh So Charming
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in the market at 7/2 (exchange 4).
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a win this season. Proven fitness and reliability at this level. Connections are capable, and the horse is holding form well, which is a key requirement for a winner[1][2].

shortlist.name: Oh Janey (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Has been running consistently in the frame, suggesting readiness to win soon. Recent form figures indicate reliability and fitness. Connections are respected, and the horse is not needing major improvement to contend[2][3].

shortlist.name: Centaq (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows improvement with a strong finish in the last race, indicating potential for another good performance.

shortlist.name: Bringsty
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a third place, suggesting some level of fitness and potential for a strong run.

shortlist.name: Aswellasabentley (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows a fourth place, indicating some level of fitness and potential for improvement.

shortlist.name: Pour Les Filles
shortlist.rationale: Clear standout on form, with a recent win and consistent placings. Top connections in Elliott and Kennedy, who are proven at this level. The odds are short but reflect genuine superiority; no need for improvementâ€”just needs to run to form.

shortlist.name: Eco Pete (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent in the frame recently, including a runner-up finish. Trainer and jockey are capable, and the odds offer some value against the favourite. Needs to find a bit more, but is the main danger if the favourite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Hitthehayson (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows clear improvement, with a win and a close second in last two starts. Well positioned in the market, and connections are solid. No major improvement neededâ€”already running to a competitive level.

shortlist.name: Tiny Angel (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three placings in last four runs. Trainer and jockey are reliable, and the horse is proven at this level. Odds offer value for a horse knocking on the door.

shortlist.name: Schiehallion (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is solid, with a second and a fifth in last two starts. Trainer is in form, and the horse is well found in the market. No major improvement required to be competitive.

shortlist.name: The Electrical Kid (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with consistent recent form figures and placed efforts in higher grade. Top connections (de Bromhead/O'Keeffe) and clear market leader, indicating strong confidence. No need for major improvement to win here.

shortlist.name: Nakassama (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner (last time out) showing marked improvement and now proven at this level. Odds reflect solid support and current form is peaking. Connections capable in this grade.

shortlist.name: Small Town Hero (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows consistent winning performances, indicating strong current form and a high likelihood of success.

shortlist.name: Stretchemout (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Trained by Gordon Elliott, a renowned trainer, and recent form suggests improvement. The odds offer value for a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Kansas (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form and competitive odds, trained by renowned Aidan O'Brien.

shortlist.name: Sirius A (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Competitive odds at 5.7 on the exchange
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form and decent odds make it a contender.

shortlist.name: Ipanema Queen (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Odds of 6.6 on the exchange offer some value
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows potential for improvement at a reasonable price.

shortlist.name: Flawless Fusion (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent strong form and favored odds suggest a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Lucia Molly (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form and reasonable odds make this a viable option.

shortlist.name: Sovereign Cry (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Market leader with strong bookmaker and exchange support. Fresh debut runner from Murphy stable partnered by in-form jockey Lee. Lack of form string suggests carefully prepared newcomer with market confidence justified by morning movements.

shortlist.name: World Tour (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Aidan O'Brien runner showing recent third-place finish indicating current form cycle. Form figures demonstrate consistency at this level with recent placed effort suggesting horse approaching peak fitness. Ballydoyle string firing and represents solid value at current odds.

shortlist.name: Vidmiyr (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent third followed by unlucky run shows improvement trajectory. Murtagh-trained runner with Coen booking indicates stable confidence. Form pattern suggests horse finding form and odds of 6.8 offer value for improving three-year-old on upward curve.

shortlist.name: Sierra De Gredos
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows consistency with a mix of wins and places, indicating a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Wegotogether (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Competitive odds and recent form suggest potential for a strong finish.

shortlist.name: Oiche Rua (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win and consistent placings, making it a viable option.

shortlist.name: Andab (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 13/8 SBK, 2.68 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level with recent form figures showing reliability and competitiveness. Trained by Joseph O'Brien, who excels at Dundalk, and partnered by a capable jockey. No signs of regression in recent runs, and market confidence is strong.

shortlist.name: Frescobaldi (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 2/1 SBK, 3.35 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections (Aidan O'Brien) and has shown ability with a recent win and consistent form. Last run can be forgiven given the overall profile. Remains unexposed and likely to be suited by conditions.

shortlist.name: Ja'marr
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with three third-place finishes in last six runs showing steady improvement. Currently racing off competitive odds suggesting market confidence. Marnane stable performs well at Dundalk AW track.

shortlist.name: Instant Appeal
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows progression with second and third-place finishes. David Egan booking adds significant value given his class. Form figures indicate horse is competitive at this level without needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Final Voyage (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Multiple placed efforts including two third-place finishes in recent form. Racing at realistic odds that reflect genuine winning chance. Murtagh yard known for Dundalk success.

shortlist.name: Valorous Power (Ger)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with encouraging recent form showing consistency. Joseph O'Brien stable provides significant trainer advantage. Current odds offer value given connections and upward trajectory in form.

shortlist.name: Sarmiento Power (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win after a string of poor runs suggests a return to form; trainer and jockey are solid, and the odds are fair for a horse that has shown it can win at this level. The win last time out is a positive signal, though the previous poor form is a slight concernâ€”watch for consistency.

shortlist.name: Marians Gal (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent placings (3rd, 3rd) indicate current fitness and competitiveness. The odds offer value for a horse that is regularly hitting the frame without winning, suggesting a breakthrough could be imminent if things fall right.

shortlist.name: Gallo Dell Cielo (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Has been competitive in recent starts, with a 2nd and a 7th in last two runs. The form is honest, and the odds are reasonable for a horse that is often in the mix. Trainer and jockey are capable, and the horse doesnâ€™t need to improve drastically to win.

shortlist.name: Zillow
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with a recent win, strong trainer connection, and favorable odds.

shortlist.name: Heather (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent strong performances and competitive odds make this a viable contender.

shortlist.name: Titanium Emperor (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is mixed but odds suggest potential value.

shortlist.name: Grand Sonata (Usa)
shortlist.rationale: Trained by Todd Pletcher, one of the most successful trainers in the US, and ridden by top jockey Tyler Gaffalione. Even without recent form, the combination of elite connections at Keeneland is a major positive. Expect this runner to be well-supported in the market and a logical contender based on stable and jockey stats alone.

shortlist.name: Goldeneye (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong jockey-trainer combo, likely single-figure odds
shortlist.rationale: Irad Ortiz Jr. is a leading rider nationally, and Kenneth McPeek is a sharp trainer, especially with developing types. This pairing suggests the horse will be ready to run a big race. The absence of recent form is a slight concern, but the connections are too strong to ignore in a race of this nature.

shortlist.name: Anglophile (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Respected connections, likely to be well-backed
shortlist.rationale: Luis Saez is a top-tier jockey, and Brian Lynch is a capable trainer. While recent form is unknown, the presence of these connections at Keeneland suggests the horse will be competitive. Expect this runner to be in the mix based on the quality of its team.

shortlist.name: San Siro (Usa)
shortlist.rationale: Frankie Dettori is a world-class jockey, and Brendan Walsh is a rising star among US trainers. The combination is intriguing, especially at a major meet like Keeneland. While recent form is not available, the presence of Dettori suggests the horse will attract support and could outrun its odds.

shortlist.name: Whataboutism (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Strong trainer and jockey combination, often indicative of a well-prepared horse.

shortlist.name: Azaniya (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Respected jockey and trainer, potential for strong performance.

shortlist.name: Pop Chart (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is outstanding, with a win and a second in last two starts, indicating peak condition. Top connections and very strong market support suggest high probability of another win.

shortlist.name: Speed Racer (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a second last time out and competitive finishes. Same trainer as the favorite, indicating stable strength. Odds reflect strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Lotus Silk (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form indicates strong performance with a second-place finish, suggesting consistency and potential for improvement. Richard Fourie is a skilled jockey, which adds to the horse's chances.

shortlist.name: Touch The Sword (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Although recent form is mixed, the odds suggest market confidence. Trainer S. B. Kotzen has a good reputation, which could influence the horse's performance.

shortlist.name: Money Galore (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with recent places, indicating a strong contender. Trainer K. Mitchley and jockey Muzi Yeni form a capable team.

shortlist.name: New Mexico (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with back-to-back wins, showing clear improvement and consistency. Odds reflect strong market support. Trainer and jockey both in good recent form. No sign of regression, and recent figures suggest he is well suited to current conditions.

shortlist.name: Pyromaniac (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistently competitive at this level, with recent runner-up finish indicating readiness. Market support is strong. Connections are reliable and the horse has proven ability to handle similar company.

shortlist.name: Mr Belvedere (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with several recent placings. Odds indicate strong market confidence. While not a prolific winner, his form is reliable and he is unlikely to need major improvement to feature.

shortlist.name: Arabian Red (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Multiple recent wins and placings, with top jockey booked. Trainer is highly respected locally. Form is strong and consistent, and odds offer value relative to proven ability.

shortlist.name: Back For More (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Clear market leader at 1.23 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Comes off a win and a second, indicating peak form. Trained by A. C. Greeff, a leading local trainer, and has the strongest recent profile in the field. Odds reflect strong confidence from the market.

shortlist.name: Olive Oyl (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent recent form with multiple seconds and a win. Also from the Greeff stable, suggesting strong yard confidence. Reliable and proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Bonjour La Ville (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Outstanding recent form with three wins in last four starts (1-1-5-1). Last start victory demonstrates current peak fitness. Consistent performer at this level with strong recent winning sequence. Muzi Yeni is a capable jockey. Offers significant value at 3.00 compared to the heavily backed favorites.

shortlist.name: Kings Again (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Strong finishing form with two consecutive thirds followed by recent win (3-3-1). Improvement trend evident in recent performances. Richard Fourie is a top-class jockey, and Greeff stable has excellent record. Recent win confirms horse is in form and ready to compete at this level. Value proposition at 3.00.

shortlist.name: Instaworthy (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner with consistent placed efforts (three consecutive thirds before last win). Form cycle suggests horse remains competitive. G.D. Smith is a quality trainer. Despite slightly longer odds, recent win and consistency pattern indicate genuine winning chance. Best value selection in the field.

shortlist.name: Beneath The Moon (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with a consistent pattern of improvement, coupled with favorable odds.

shortlist.name: Faraway Girl (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows consistent improvement and competitive odds make it a value bet.

shortlist.name: Globetonic (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Strong favorite at 1.83 with solid recent form showing a win (1) and multiple placings. Latest run was a first, indicating current peak form. Trainer G.D. Smith has multiple runners, suggesting confidence in stable form.

shortlist.name: Rougarouin (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a third and first in last two starts before the break. JVA Strydom trainer has another runner, indicating yard confidence. Competitive odds offer value against the favorite.

shortlist.name: Supreme Judge (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Excellent consistency with multiple seconds and a recent first-place finish (1) followed by fourth and seventh. G.D. Smith stable form is strong with multiple entries. Form cycle suggests horse remains competitive at this level.

shortlist.name: The Roaring Rock (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive form pattern showing improvement with two wins (1-1) and consistent placings in recent starts. A.C. Greeff is a quality trainer with strong local record. At 3.0, offers decent each-way value.

shortlist.name: Buffalo Bill (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a strong finish in the last race, indicating peak performance.

shortlist.name: Griffin Park (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent improvement in form with a decent finish, suggesting potential for a strong run.

shortlist.name: Wordsworth (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with recent wins, indicating a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Ravilious (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and consistent form suggest a strong potential for success.
